definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem

sentences.english: This is a normal activity that cats find calming and reassuring.
sentences.chinese: 這是貓兒們讓自己冷靜下來的慣常行動。

sentences.english: It is not worth while to go round the world to count the cats in Zanzibar.
sentences.chinese: 數桑給巴爾島的貓兒有多少隻而寰遊世界是划不來的。

sentences.english: The cats are housed in a compound about the size of a three-room flat.
sentences.chinese: 貓兒居住的院子面積只有三房式組屋般大小。

sentences.english: Studies on the freshwater fishes of Maoer mountain nature reserve;
sentences.chinese: 貓兒山自然保護區位於廣西壯族自治區東北部。

sentences.english: The cat was sitting on an upturned crate.
sentences.chinese: 貓兒蹲坐在倒放的板條箱上。

sentences.english: A blate cat makes a proud mouse.
Cats, unlike dogs or even elephants, aren't associated with altruistic, empathic behavior.
sentences.chinese: 貓兒不像狗或是大象那樣具有利他的，移情的行爲。

sentences.english: Its design concept is "to see the world from the cat 's-eyes".
sentences.chinese: 它的設計概念是“從貓兒眼裏看到的世界”。

sentences.english: The cat laid down upon the pillow and was happy.
sentences.chinese: 貓兒躺在枕頭上，很高興。

sentences.english: I saw you feed stray cat, and I learned that it was good to be kind to animals.
sentences.chinese: 我看到你給迷途的貓兒餵食，就知道要善待動物。

sentences.english: Good gracious, cats are naturally the enemies of dogs, you know.
sentences.chinese: 我的天主，貓兒，您知道，生來就是狗的對頭。

sentences.english: Ah, by the way, is your cat still cross?
sentences.chinese: 可了不得，您的貓兒還是那麼兇嗎？
買一隻歪歪扭扭的貓兒。

sentences.english: The cat was sitting on an upturned crate .
sentences.chinese: 貓兒蹲坐在倒放的板條箱上。

sentences.english: They are as heedless and as indolent as cats.
sentences.chinese: 他們都和貓兒一樣，懶惰馴良。

sentences.english: She wishes ro ride on the 'CAT' to go everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 她希望騎着貓兒去每個地方。

definition: yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to be made to stand still as a punishment
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
